interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/08/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Patterson'], 'Producers': ['Adam Dietrich', 'Melissa Kirkendall', 'James Montague'], 'Starring': ['Sierra McCormick', 'Jake Horowitz', 'Gail Cronauer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: I love this.
This film really transports you to the 1950s. Not in that flashy stereotyped way, but as though you really existed in some small town 1950s era town.
It is an intimate film.. Like something you would tell around a campfire...
The film really captures the atmosphere and ambience of the town and the era....
Reminds me of driving in a car late at night and you are listening to COAST to COAST radio.. or sitting in your bed late at night listening to the radio....

Love it. More of this kind of filmmaking please.. less over the top "special effects" that get so boring..

Great movie. Review Title: Really draws you in..... Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Doc Martin Special Collection: Series 1-5 plus the Movies Clunes, Martin (Actor), Catz, Caroline (Actor), Ferguson, Craig (Director) & 0 more Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy ['“Sweet, stirring, and completely addictive” ––', 'Slate', '“Delightfully quirky” —', 'Los Angeles Times', 'He’s surly, tactless, self-centered, and uptight—but he’s the only doctor in town. Relocating to the picturesque village of Portwenn is not what this doctor ordered. After developing a crippling fear of blood, hotshot London surgeon Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes,', 'Men Behaving Badly', ') reluctantly retrains as a GP and opens a practice in the quirky seaside town, where he quickly offends the villagers with his dour and dismissive bedside manner. In these five complete series, Doc Martin catches the eye of the most beautiful woman in Portwenn (Caroline Catz,', 'Murder in Suburbia', '), tests the patience of his long-suffering aunt (Stephanie Cole,', 'Tenko', '), and repeatedly hurts feelings as he heals bodies. The two feature-length movies reveal the character’s first incarnation as Dr. Martin Bamford. He’s still ornery but less socially inept, an obstetrician fleeing to the coastal village to reassess his marriage and career. Martin Clunes delivers an uproarious lead performance, aided by outstanding supporting casts, in this award-winning fish-out-of-water comedy.'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Contributor': 'Absolom, Joe, Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Ferguson, Craig', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '13', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '5.5 x 3.6 x 7.7 inches; 15.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '21388', 'Director': 'Ferguson, Craig', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Run time': '32 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 7, 2013', 'Actors': 'Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Absolom, Joe', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '13'} I really love this series..
It is funny, the timing is great.
Well written and boy, I want to live in a village like Portwenn.

The only criticism I have as I move through this series is more on the portrayal of alternative medicine. Obviously Doc Martin is strickly Left brain my way or the highway medical science is best. And the series generally portrays any alternative more natural theories as utterly quackish I feel that I had to say something because in all honesty I do not feel that natural alternative medicine is portrayed very fairly. It is completely maligned and mocked while Doc Ellingham is generally won out to be right all the time.

I just wanted folks to know that this is not exacty a balanced portrayal. Yes, some alternative theories can be take to extreme.. but so can very left brain approaches in medicine and science.

For example.. overuse of antibiotics. Antibiotics are useful but overprescribed generally by doctors for everything. He is somewhat more mannered that Edith... his ex.. who is VERY elitist.

Anyway.. that is my 2 cents I really love this series {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Grant Baldwin'], 'Producers': ['Jenny Rustemeyer'], 'Starring': ['Jonathan Bloom', 'Tristram Stuart', 'Dana Gunders']} This is a MUST WATCH Documentary!. I have been wanting to see this for a while now because I know it is a horrendous issue. Furthermore, I know I am IMMENSELY GUILTY for wasting food.

I am striving to change my ways and save $$ on food, on working not to waste so much food and to help bring awareness to this issue.

I know "shaming" folks is frowned upon.. but maybe this is something we should shame . People are supposidly going hungry and the question is WHY?

It is our perceptions of food. Those perceptions are cultivated by the ADVERTISING industry and so I think they need to do a lot more to focus on this. I think fast food companies, and markets and anyone that produces food needs to take responsibility for and UNDO the damage they have done.! MUST WATCH DOCUMENTARY. !!!! Planet X Nibiru and the Anunnaki Special Interest ['Lloyd Pye reveals information regarding the genetic manipulation of the human species by an alien race from another planet. This planet is said to have a 3,600 year elliptical orbit which may currently be approaching our solar system. Is Planet X Nibiru inhabited and inbound?'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Sepehr'], 'Producers': ['Robert Sepehr'], 'Starring': ['LloydPye']} It's not the content that I have an issue with but all this video is is a boring interview with Lloyd Pie
I thought I was getting a documentary but all it is is this guy talking.

Not worth 2 dollars.. not worth one..

Be warned this is not a documentary but a boring interview. This could have just been uploaded to You Tube .. Just a boring interview.. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Lowery'], 'Producers': ['Toby Halbrooks', 'James M. Johnston', 'Adam Donaghey'], 'Starring': ['Casey Affleck', 'Rooney Mara'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']} I hate reading any reviews before I watch a film. It is hard not to though.
No, this isn't a "scary" Halloween movie , but it is about a ghost. It is about a lot more.
It is meditative. If you are in for an action flick. This isn't it.

But it is VERY good. Give it a chance. If you are in a calm, meditative and contemplative space this is for you. Open yourself up to the quiet of this film.

I won't give the plot away. It is more about feeling and thinking and being and not being.. that is all I will say.

Peace A very good, meditative and contemplative movie and that is a GOOD thing. Very recommended. {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Devlin'], 'Producers': ['Dean Devlin', 'David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Marc Roskin', 'Don Granger', 'Herbert W. Gains'], 'Starring': ['Gerard Butler', 'Jim Sturgess', 'Abbie Cornish'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} The special effects and script are cheesy and sloppy. I guess I should have known better.
I hate when they make disaster special effects that are utterly ridiculous and over the top. They ruin the movies.
It could have been a 1/2way decent flick if they made it more "realistic" . Got rid of the tropish characters and had a better script. I guess I should have known better. I hate when they make disaster special effects ... {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Florian Habicht'], 'Starring': ['Claudia Aiono', 'Huia Apiata', 'Barbara Armstrong'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} This is actually really good documentary. The makeup is great and the interviews are more than just about the "spook house". There are real people who talk deeper about the psychology of this site and their own personal history and what got them into doing this work. Nicely filmed. Interesting to have a different cultural take on Horror houses. Very Good! {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adrian Molina', 'Lee Unkrich'], 'Producers': ['Darla K. Anderson'], 'Starring': ['Anthony Gonzalez', 'Gael García Bernal', 'Benjamin Bratt'], 'Studio': ['Pixar']} Ok, this movie made me cry...
I am big into Geneology and I used to always have an ancestor altar... and I need to put one up again. Made me cry... in a good way. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Juan Carlos Medina', 'Alice Troughton', 'Sarah Walker'], 'Producers': ['Deborah Harkness', 'Lachlan MacKinnon'], 'Starring': ['Matthew Goode', 'Teresa Palmer', 'Valarie Pettiford']} I have read all the books and this adaption is excellent. Very well done.

Nuff said EXCELLENT!!! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kevin Costner', 'Curtis Crawford', 'Curt Truninger'], 'Producers': ['Jim Wilson', 'Steve Tisch', 'Kevin Costner'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Costner', 'Will Patton', 'Larenz Tate'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Watching it cause I was in a bit of an end of the world mood and needed some hope Better than I thought, I actually teared up a few times {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Producers': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Starring': ['Barrett Brown', 'Jeremy Hammond'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Important to watch in retrospect of the Trump debacle and the QAnon disinformation/psychological campaign!
If you want to understand why Trump was elected and why QAnon and Flat earth came into being? It was in reaction to the fact that folks who were dedicated to uncovering the Truth were getting too powerful. The only way to bring the Truth movement down was to poison the well and create a fake disinfo campaign to discredit the entire REAL Truth movement.. important to watch {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Julie Taymor'], 'Producers': ['Julie Taymor', 'Lynn Hendee'], 'Starring': ['Julianne Moore', 'Alicia Vikander', 'Timothy Hutton'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']} I will admit, that being born in 1968 to a strong mother who was just 2-3 months older than Gloria Steinem I might be accused for taking too much for granted.

My mother got married in 1966 .. but she was already a doctor and had gone to Medical school in the 1950s when most women were becoming homemakers!. The youngest of 3, her father encouraged her to go into medicine, not nursing , like her older sister. My parents divorced in 1977 (and my father, despite his own weaknesses was a nice good man). My mother ended up raising me by herself. I had my own personal struggles growing up but feeling inferior to a boy or a man was not one of them. Both my parents loved me and gave me all they could. I didn't really identify with the "Feminist" struggle although I appreciated it intellectually. I was active in the Pro Choice movement as a right for women to control their own bodies. However, it was the more militant feminism of the 90s that unfortunately turned me away from the Feminist movement and I felt that a lot of the issues got lost among fighting over political correct speech, endlessly talking about how men are evil patriarchal rapists... So.. it was nice to return to the context on which the real women's struggle was about.

It is hard to sympathise with a woman in the United states that generally (generally) has it easy.. while in places like India... women are STILL struggling for basic dignity and respect.. Or in Afganistan where the Taliban is coming back into power to oppress once again.. or in Saudi Arabia .... and while yes, the United States is losing the battle with the Pro Choice movement..... I fear it is because women in the US have lost the path... fighting over silly things rather than critically important ones... Unfortunately it is about "branding your message" sorry to say that..

I don't demonize women who wanted to be homemakers. I think opportunties should be available for all women.. but that includes NOT being expected to take on big roles just because people like Gloria fought for that.. it wasn't JUST so all girls would desire to be president but they would also have the dignity of staying at home and raising children if that is their CHOICE... again.. it is about CHOICE and about our personal awareness of what we want, the realities of what is biologically available... as sucky that may be...

Overall, very enjoyable and inspiring. Nice review of the woman's movement {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Patterson'], 'Producers': ['Adam Dietrich', 'Melissa Kirkendall', 'James Montague'], 'Starring': ['Sierra McCormick', 'Jake Horowitz', 'Gail Cronauer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} I love this.
This film really transports you to the 1950s. Not in that flashy stereotyped way, but as though you really existed in some small town 1950s era town.
It is an intimate film.. Like something you would tell around a campfire...
The film really captures the atmosphere and ambience of the town and the era....
Reminds me of driving in a car late at night and you are listening to COAST to COAST radio.. or sitting in your bed late at night listening to the radio....

Love it. More of this kind of filmmaking please.. less over the top "special effects" that get so boring..

Great movie. Really draws you in.....
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user has a keen appreciation for comedy series with strong character development and clever storytelling, alongside impactful documentaries exploring social issues, particularly feminism, cultural perspectives, and political narratives.

- **Themes:** They favor narratives set in quaint, feel-good locations and are drawn to introspective films examining personal histories and cultural heritage. Their recent interactions indicate a growing interest in nuanced feminist themes and critiques of contemporary societal issues.

- **Recent Engagement:** Most recently, the user reviewed a film that authentically evokes the 1950s, praising its intimate storytelling and atmospheric qualities. Their review emphasized a preference for subtle cinematics over flashy special effects, aligning with their commitment to emotional narratives and cultural depth.

- **Perspectives on Media Quality:** The user maintains a critical eye for production quality and authenticity, expressing disappointment with subpar elements while emphasizing the importance of depth in storytelling and realistic portrayals of social complexities.

- **Review Engagement:** They actively engage in providing thoughtful critiques that celebrate content aligning with their values, advocating for diverse cultural interpretations and socio-political insights.

- **Rating Habits:** With a commendable average rating, they recognize well-crafted content and hold filmmakers accountable for narratives that fall short, reinforcing their commitment to quality storytelling.

Overall, this user balances a love for comedic entertainment with an appreciation for well-crafted emotional narratives and critical explorations of societal issues while upholding rigorous expectations for quality in storytelling.
